name: Jardim Zoológico de Lisboa (Lisbon Zoo)
tagline: Over 140 years of history with 2,000 animals from 300 species in the heart of Lisbon

description.short: Lisbon Zoo is one of the world's oldest zoos, established in 1884. Home to approximately 2,000 animals from 300 species, it combines conservation, education, and entertainment in a beautiful park setting in central Lisbon.
description.full: Jardim Zoológico de Lisboa, established in 1884, is one of the oldest and most respected zoological parks in the world. Spanning 16 hectares in the heart of Lisbon, the zoo houses approximately 2,000 animals representing about 300 different species from around the globe. The zoo's mission extends far beyond entertainment - it plays a crucial role in conservation, scientific research, and environmental education. Visitors can explore diverse habitats including the Dolphin Bay with daily shows, the Enchanted Forest bird presentation, the Valley of Tigers featuring Sumatran tigers, the Temple of Primates with gorillas and chimpanzees, MEO Savannah with elephants and giraffes, the Reptile House, and the popular Lidl Children's Farm where kids can interact with domestic animals. The zoo offers included attractions such as the cable car providing aerial views, the miniature train tour around the park, and multiple daily animal presentations and feeding demonstrations. The park is beautifully landscaped with gardens, water features, and shaded walkways. As a member of EAZA, WAZA, and other international conservation organizations, Lisbon Zoo participates in numerous breeding programs for endangered species. The zoo emphasizes animal welfare, biodiversity conservation, and creating meaningful connections between visitors and wildlife. With its combination of education, conservation, and family entertainment, Lisbon Zoo provides a full day of discovery and fun for all ages.
description.history: Inaugurated on May 28, 1884, Jardim Zoológico de Lisboa is one of the oldest zoos in the world and has been a Lisbon institution for over 140 years. The zoo was originally located in Palhavã but moved to its current location in Sete Rios in 1905. Throughout its history, it has evolved from a traditional Victorian-era menagerie to a modern conservation-focused zoological park. The zoo has weathered challenges including both World Wars and Portugal's political changes, adapting and modernizing to meet contemporary standards for animal welfare and conservation. Major renovations and expansions throughout the decades have created specialized habitats, improved visitor facilities, and enhanced educational programs. Today it stands as a testament to Lisbon's commitment to wildlife conservation and public education.
description.significance: As a founding member of EAZA (European Association of Zoos and Aquaria), WAZA (World Association of Zoos and Aquariums), and participant in EEP (European Endangered Species Programmes), Lisbon Zoo plays a vital role in global conservation efforts. The zoo participates in breeding programs for endangered species, conducts important research, and educates over one million visitors annually about biodiversity and conservation. It serves as Portugal's premier zoological institution and a major family attraction in Lisbon.

directions.general: Located in Sete Rios, northwest of central Lisbon, near Benfica neighborhood
directions.fromCruisePort: 35-40 minutes by metro - Blue Line to Jardim Zoológico station with direct access to zoo entrance
directions.publicTransport: Metro: Blue Line to Jardim Zoológico station (exit leads directly to zoo). Buses: 701, 716, 726, 746, 755, 758. Train: Sete Rios station (5-minute walk).
directions.parking: Paid parking available at zoo entrance and nearby shopping centers

admissionPrices.notes: Children under 3 free. Youth/Child rate for ages 3-12. Senior rate for 65+. Online tickets save 2-3 euros. Family packages available. Lisboa Card provides 15% discount. Includes cable car, train ride, and all animal presentations.

visitingInformation.bestTimeToVisit: Weekday mornings for fewer crowds. Arrive at opening to see animals most active. Plan around dolphin show times (check schedule).
visitingInformation.adviceForVisitors: Wear comfortable walking shoes and sun protection. Bring water and snacks or use zoo restaurants. Check daily schedule for animal presentations and feeding times. Don't miss the dolphin show (2 shows daily). The cable car provides great aerial views. Allow 4-5 hours to see everything. Children's Farm is perfect for little ones. Map available at entrance - plan your route. Come early in summer as animals are more active in cooler hours.

cruisePassengerInfo.timeNeededFromPort: 5-6 hours total including 35-minute metro ride each way and 4-hour zoo visit
cruisePassengerInfo.accessibility: Good - Blue Line metro goes directly to zoo entrance. Zoo has some hills but mostly accessible paths.
tips: Blue Line metro goes directly to zoo - very convenient
Buy tickets online to save money and skip queues
Check dolphin show schedule and plan around it
Cable car and train rides included in admission
Allow 4-5 hours minimum to see everything
Bring sunscreen and hats in summer
Zoo has restaurants but bringing snacks saves money
Children's Farm is must-visit for families with young kids
Get there at opening for most active animals

highlights: Dolphin Bay with spectacular dolphin shows (twice daily)
Enchanted Forest bird presentation with free-flying birds
MEO Savannah with elephants, giraffes, and zebras
Valley of Tigers featuring Sumatran tigers
Temple of Primates with gorillas and chimpanzees
Iberian Lynx Grove showcasing endangered species
Reptile House with snakes, crocodiles, and lizards
Lidl Children's Farm with domestic animals
Cable car ride over the zoo (included)
Miniature train tour around the park (included)

accessibility.mobilityNotes: Most paths are paved and accessible. Some areas have slopes. Wheelchairs available for rent. Cable car and train are accessible. Some viewing areas may be challenging.

heroImage.alt: Lisbon Zoo entrance with visitors and lush vegetation
heroImage.caption: Jardim Zoológico de Lisboa welcomes over one million visitors annually to explore wildlife from around the world

gallery.alt: Dolphin show at Lisbon Zoo Dolphin Bay
gallery.caption: The spectacular dolphin show is one of the zoo's most popular attractions

gallery.alt: Giraffes at MEO Savannah habitat in Lisbon Zoo
gallery.caption: The African savannah habitat houses giraffes, elephants, zebras, and other species

gallery.alt: Cable car ride over Lisbon Zoo
gallery.caption: The cable car provides aerial views of the zoo and is included in admission

gallery.alt: Children at Lidl Children's Farm petting animals
gallery.caption: The Children's Farm allows kids to interact safely with domestic animals
